<a id="InputEventShortcut"></a>

# InputEventShortcut

**Inherits:** [InputEvent](InputEvent.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Represents a triggered keyboard [Shortcut](Shortcut.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

InputEventShortcut is a special event that can be received in [Node._input()](Node.md#Node_private_method__input), [Node._shortcut_input()](Node.md#Node_private_method__shortcut_input), and [Node._unhandled_input()](Node.md#Node_private_method__unhandled_input). It is typically sent by the editor's Command Palette to trigger actions, but can also be sent manually using [Viewport.push_input()](Viewport.md#Viewport_method_push_input).

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="InputEventShortcut_property_shortcut"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Shortcut](Shortcut.md) **shortcut** [ðŸ”—](#InputEventShortcut_property_shortcut)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_shortcut**\ (\ value\: [Shortcut](Shortcut.md)\ )
- [Shortcut](Shortcut.md) **get_shortcut**\ (\ )

The [Shortcut](Shortcut.md) represented by this event. Its [Shortcut.matches_event()](Shortcut.md#Shortcut_method_matches_event) method will always return ``true`` for this event.
